content.readme:
# Visual Image Composer

A visual node-based image generation tool built with Next.js, React Flow, and AI APIs.

![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-1.9.0-blue.svg)

## Documentation

- [API Documentation](src/app/api/openapi.json)
- [Fal.ai API Guide](docs/fal-ai-api.md)

## Features

- **Node-Based Workflow**: Create complex image generation pipelines using visual nodes
- **AI-Powered Generation**: Integrate with various AI image generation services
- **Real-Time Preview**: See your compositions come to life as you build
- **Customizable Nodes**: Add prompts, styles, aspect ratios, and more
- **Settings Log System**: Automatically track and restore generation settings
- **Download Functionality**: Download individual images or entire generations with smart filenames
- **Version Control**: Track and manage different versions of your images
- **Canvas Navigation**: Pan and zoom the canvas to access all nodes

## Canvas Navigation

### Panning the Canvas

Move the canvas to access nodes outside the visible viewport:

**Method 1: Middle Mouse Button** (Recommended)
- Click and hold the **middle mouse button** (scroll wheel button)
- Drag to pan the canvas in any direction

**Method 2: Shift + Scroll**
- Hold the **Shift** key
- Scroll with your mouse wheel to pan horizontally/vertically

### Zooming

- **Mouse Wheel**: Scroll to zoom in/out
- **Control Panel**: Use zoom buttons in the control panel node
- **Pinch Gesture**: On touch devices, pinch to zoom

### Moving Nodes

- **Left Mouse Button**: Click and drag any node to reposition it
- Nodes snap to a 20Ã—20 grid for precise alignment

## Getting Started

First, install dependencies:

```bash
npm install
```

Then, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

## Project Structure

- `src/components/nodes/` - Individual node components for the canvas (including SettingsLogNode)
- `src/app/api/generate/` - API route for image generation
- `src/lib/store.ts` - Zustand state management with settings logging
- `src/lib/download.ts` - Download utilities for images with smart filename generation

## Download Features

### Single Image Download
- Click on any generated image to open the preview
- Click the "Download" button to save the image
- Automatic filename generation: `prompt-model-date.png`

### Batch Download
- Use the "Download All" button in the Generation History node
- Downloads all images from your generation history
- Each image gets a unique filename with index: `prompt-model-date-img1.png`

### Smart Filenames
Filenames are automatically generated based on:
- **Prompt**: First 30 characters, cleaned of special characters
- **Model**: Short model name (e.g., "flux-pro")
- **Date**: Generation date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- **Index**: Sequential number for batch downloads

## Technologies Used

- [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) - React framework
- [React Flow](https://reactflow.dev) - Node-based UI library
- [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com) - Styling
- [Zustand](https://zustand-demo.pmnd.rs) - State management
- [Playwright](https://playwright.dev) - Testing

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please read the contributing guidelines first.

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.
